text: Évariste Galois (25 October 1811 - 31 May 1832) was a French mathematician. He died from a gunshot wound he received in a duel.Stewart, J., et al. Algebra and Trigonometry. p. 334. Today, he is known for his theory about algebraic equations which is known as Galois theory. ==References== Category:1811 births Category:1832 deaths Category:French mathematicians Category:Algebraists Category:Duels
title: Évariste Galois
